interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Blue Collar TV - Season 1, Vol. 1
Review Date: 2013/09/11
Store: Jeff Foxworthy  (Actor, Writer),     Larry the Cable Guy  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'The guys who had you laughing on the Blue Collar Comedy Tour - Jeff Foxworthy, Bill Engvall and Larry the Cable Guy - bring their particular brand of hilarity to Blue Collar TV: Season 1 Volume 1. Expect a hometown buffet of TV parodies, sketches, and stand-up, celebrating everything from spouses to spoilers, Winnebagos to Waffle Houses, cheap beer to even cheaper lingerie. You are about to get a 64-oz. Big Gulp of blue collar comedy. Are you ready?', 'DVD Features:', 'Documentary', 'Other', 'Amazon.com', 'Blue Collar TV', 'finds three of the boys from', 'Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie', 'and', 'Blue Collar Comedy Tour Rides Again', 'in a sketch comedy format, supported by a talented ensemble of comic players and writers who know how to build on the stars\' individual strengths. Jeff Foxworthy is the series\' anchor, opening each episode in the 1994 debut season with a strong monologue riffing on one or another theme: marriage, bad jobs, sports, vacations, family, partying. Happy redneck Larry the Cable Guy and NASCAR-loving Everyman Bill Engvall join Foxworthy in energetic skits that definitely become funnier and bolder with each new show. Among the best sketches is "CSI: Greater Greensboro Tri-Area," in which Foxworthy\'s crime-scene sleuth is on the trail of a deerslayer. "Lingerie for Couples Together 20 Years" spotlights such hot domestic garb as sweatshirts accented with a ratty, cat-hair-covered blanket from the back of a closet. "Hug or Hit" is a mock game show in which a terrified contestant has to predict whether a drunk sleeping in a glass booth will, upon awakening, embrace or take a swing at him.', 'The recurring "I believe" format finds Foxworthy, Larry, and Engvall piously revealing articles of their faith in this hard, hard world: "I believe," Engvall says, "that Angelina Jolie thinks about me as much as I think about her." Right. Guest star Ron White (the missing fourth partner from the', 'Blue Collar', "tours), cigarette and Scotch-on-the-rocks in hand, lends his decadent (and welcome) persona here and there to the proceedings. Drew Carey shows up as well, but it's the series' obvious growth over 13 episodes that makes", 'Blue Collar TV', 'a comedy success.', '--Tom Keogh']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Documentary, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Larry the Cable Guy, Adam Weiss, Nathan Wright, Tom Park, Ron White, Kurt Heydle, Ashley Eckstein, Adam Small, AmyKathryn Jones, Kathy Katz, Bill Engvall, Ted Kenney, Heath Hyche, Peter Oldring, Brooke Dillman, Ayda Field, Fax Bahr, Gary Anthony Williams, Jeff FoxworthyLarry the Cable Guy, Adam Weiss, Nathan Wright, Tom Park, Ron White, Kurt Heydle, Ashley Eckstein, Adam Small, AmyKathryn Jones, Kathy Katz, Bill Engvall, Ted Kenney, Heath Hyche, Peter Oldring, Brooke Dillman, Ayda Field, Fax Bahr, Gary Anthony Williams, Jeff Foxworthy   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Runtime': '5 hours and 2 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7 x 5.75 x 0.5 inches; 5.6 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '5 hours and 2 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 8, 2005', 'Actors': 'Jeff Foxworthy, Larry the Cable Guy, Bill Engvall, Brooke Dillman, Nathan Wright', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Producers': 'Kathy Katz, Ted Kenney, Tom Park', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Writers': 'Adam Small, Fax Bahr, Jeff Foxworthy', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: I like good redneck humor and this is it! You might be a redneck if.....FUNNY! Jeff Foxworthy, Bill Engvall and Larry the Cable Guy have done it again with a lot of laughs smash hit and of course, some redneck humor! Freakin funnier than ever yee hahah!
Review Title: Great Redneck Humor!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Wish they had more of Don DC Curry! The other artists are funny as well, some are younger shots of current/recent successful comedians, but other than that I would rate it a 8.5. Definitely worth a look!
Hilarious!
The Warriors [Blu-ray](Ultimate Directors cut)
Michael Beck  (Actor),     James Remar  (Actor),     Walter Hill  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure
['Warriors, The (BD)', "A battle of gigantic proportions is looming in the neon underground of N ew York City. The armies of the night number 100,000; they o utnumber th e police 5 to 1; and tonight they're after the Warriors - a street gang blamed unfairly for a rival gang leader's death. This contemporary actio n-adventure story takes place at night, underground, in the sub-culture of gang warfare that rages from Coney Island to Manhattan to the Bronx. Members of the Warriors fight for their lives, seek to survive in the u rban jungle and learn the meaning of loyalty. This intense and stylized film is a dazzling achievement for cinematographer Andrew Laszlo.", ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Drama, Mystery & Suspense/Crime, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen, Multiple Formats, Blu-ray', 'Contributor': 'Michael Beck, Brian Tyler, Walter Hill, David Harris, Dorsey Wright, James Remar', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Mono), French (Mono)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'PTCA1000370216BR', 'Director': 'Walter Hill', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 3, 2008', 'Actors': 'Michael Beck, James Remar, Dorsey Wright, Brian Tyler, David Harris', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Warner Bros.', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Just a present for my wife! She's is a nut case fro this movie so I got it for her as a gag gift!
I got it for my wife, she loves it!

Happy redneck Larry the Cable Guy and NASCAR-loving Everyman Bill Engvall join Foxworthy in energetic skits that definitely become funnier and bolder with each new show. Among the best sketches is "CSI: Greater Greensboro Tri-Area," in which Foxworthy\'s crime-scene sleuth is on the trail of a deerslayer. Right. Guest star Ron White (the missing fourth partner from the', 'Blue Collar', "tours), cigarette and Scotch-on-the-rocks in hand, lends his decadent (and welcome) persona here and there to the proceedings. Drew Carey shows up as well, but it's the series' obvious growth over 13 episodes that makes", 'Blue Collar TV', 'a comedy success.', '--Tom Keogh']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interests:** The user continues to focus primarily on comedy, with a strong affinity for stand-up and variety shows, and a notable appreciation for redneck humor. They remain engaged with action-adventure films but now demonstrate a deepened appreciation for comedic content featuring established talents like Jeff Foxworthy and emerging artists alike.

- **Format Preference:** The preference for physical media is reaffirmed through continued purchases of DVDs, emphasizing a collection mentality that values tangible formats.

- **Engagement with Artists:** The user shows an active engagement with both veteran and emerging comedians. Recent interactions highlight a love for comedic sketches and ensemble casts that focus on relatable humor and cultural references.

- **Rating Pattern:** Their rating pattern remains consistent with high scores for comedic content, notably giving a perfect rating for material that resonates with their taste, showcasing a strong bias toward enjoyable comedic experiences.

- **Review Style:** Reviews are characterized by personal insights and enthusiasm, now including humorous commentary on the material, signifying a growing integration of humor into their critiques.

- **Long-term Affinity:** The user has a long-standing commitment to comedy but is also exploring how other genres can enhance their enjoyment and serve as thoughtful gifts, reflecting a diverse entertainment palate that blends humor with personal connections.
